alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 8:51PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Grafton County through 930 PM EDT... At 851 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairlee, or 15 miles northeast of Lebanon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plymouth, Hanover, Groton, Piermont, Woodstock, Lyme, Benton, Dorchester, Ellsworth, Wentworth, Rumney, Warren, and Orford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
